preqs: For students who commenced their LLB course prior to 2015: LAW1100 OR LAW1101 and LAW1102 or LAW1104; LAW2201

rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {LAW2201}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {1074} Do Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567} Otherwise true
Any co-req (I/W) unit in {LAW1100, LAW1101, LAW1102, LAW1104}

proh: For students who commenced their LLB course prior to 2015: LAW2200
description: This unit will be primarily concerned with the tort of negligence. Students will be introduced to the basic elements of the tort of negligence - namely, duty of care, breach of duty, causation, remoteness, defences and remedies. Students will then examine "particular duty situations". Among the particular duty situations considered will be: pure economic loss caused by negligent statements, pure economic loss caused by negligent acts, psychological damage, rescuers, omissions and defective products and structures. Students will also consider statutory compensation schemes that have been introduced to supplement the tort of negligence.
